base_style: Retro video game pixel art sprite (NOT digital illustration), black 1px outlines, light source from upper-left (highlights on upper-left edges, shadows on lower-right), medium saturation colors (vibrant but earthy, not neon), crisp pixelated edges, no anti-aliasing, no smooth gradients
aesthetic: Mythic Greek world with weathered, lived-in feel, mix of human, divine, and monstrous
do_not_constrain: specific colors (let subjects dictate, unless god palette specified)

what_works: Explicit 'retro video game pixel art sprite' framing
Mentioning 'NOT digital illustration' to prevent drift
Character descriptions that include equipment/clothing details
God palettes applied to full character designs
what_fails: Vague creature descriptions can drift to illustration style
Without explicit pixel art framing, model defaults to smooth digital art
reference_examples: examples/zeus_tunic_reference.png - ideal pixel art style, proper outlines, good palette use

animation_guidance.format: Horizontal sprite sheet, all frames same height, each frame shows same character in different pose
animation_guidance.prompt_pattern: sprite sheet showing [N] animation frames of [character] in a [action] sequence, frames arranged left to right, each frame [size]x[size] pixels

zeus.description: gold, electric blue, white, storm dark

demeter.description: gentle green, frost blue, gentle yellow
